case_title: MUHAMMAD YUSUF vs GOVERNMENT OF BALUCHISTAN AND OTHERS

accussed_details.name: Respondent No. 3
allegation: Improper promotion to Deputy Director, Agriculture (Research)

complaint_summary: The appellant, Muhammad Yusuf, challenged the promotion of Respondent No. 3 to the post of Deputy Director, Agriculture (Research), claiming it was ultra vires and inconsistent with the Agriculture Service (Class I) Rules, 1965. The appellant argued that he was senior and entitled to the post.
investigation_summary: The appellant filed a representation against Respondent No. 3's promotion, which was partly accepted, leading to his own promotion as Deputy Director on 1973-06-26. However, he remained dissatisfied and filed an appeal seeking cancellation of Respondent No. 3's promotion, which had occurred on 1973-06-02.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal dismissed the appeal, citing lack of jurisdiction under Section 4 of the Baluchistan Service Tribunals Act, 1974, as the matter pertained to fitness for promotion, which is excluded from the Tribunal's scope. The Tribunal also held that declaring a post vacant does not fall within the terms and conditions of service.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal dismissed with no order as to costs.
legal_arguments: Section 4 of Baluchistan Service Tribunals Act, 1974 excludes jurisdiction over fitness for promotion.
Proviso (b) of Section 4 bars appeals regarding fitness to hold or be promoted to a post.
Civil Servants Act and Agriculture Service (Class I) Rules, 1965 govern promotion procedures but do not fall under Tribunal jurisdiction.
sections: Section 4 of Baluchistan Service Tribunals Act, 1974
key_issues: Jurisdiction of Tribunal under Section 4 of Baluchistan Service Tribunals Act, 1974
Validity of promotion procedures under Civil Servants Act and Agriculture Service (Class I) Rules, 1965
Maintainability of appeal under Section 4 of Baluchistan Service Tribunals Act, 1974
Fitness of Respondent No. 3 for promotion
Jurisdiction of Tribunal to declare post vacant

legal_terms.ultra vires: Beyond the powers or authority of the entity making the decision.
legal_terms.proviso: A clause in a statute that qualifies or restricts its application.

words_and_phrases.fitness for promotion: Assessment of suitability for a higher post.
words_and_phrases.terms and conditions of service: Rules governing employment in a government department.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved a service appeal by Muhammad Yusuf challenging the promotion of Respondent No. 3 to Deputy Director, Agriculture (Research). The Tribunal dismissed the appeal, citing lack of jurisdiction under Section 4 of the Baluchistan Service Tribunals Act, 1974, which excludes appeals related to fitness for promotion.

facts.appellant_claim: Promotion of Respondent No. 3 to Research Wing was improper; appellant should have been promoted instead.

issues: Maintainability of appeal under Section 4 of Baluchistan Service Tribunals Act, 1974
Fitness of Respondent No. 3 for promotion
Jurisdiction of Tribunal to declare post vacant

arguments.appellant: Promotion of Respondent No. 3 violated rules; appellant is senior and entitled to the post.
arguments.respondents: Fitness for promotion is beyond Tribunal's jurisdiction under Section 4 of the Act.

reasoning: Fitness for promotion is outside Tribunal's jurisdiction under Section 4(b)(i) of the Act.
Declaration of vacancy does not fall within terms and conditions of service.
decision.final_order: Appeal dismissed with no order as to costs.
